instruction:
Help me run all cells in this jupyter notebook. I hope to check the results.
Here is a step-by-step tutorial from an expert instructing you how to complete it:
To run all cells in a jupyter notebook, one method is to run each cell one-by-one. Another simple method is to run all cells using one operation. To achieve this:
1. In the opened VSCode interface, firstly locate and click the button "Run All" in the menu bar on the top.
2. Wait for a short time and all cells should be executed.
You can follow the detailed GUI plan above using `pyautogui` or proactively tackle the task using Python code
